Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa

Class TemporalHierarchyClassification

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa.TemporalHierarchyClassification
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener
public class TemporalHierarchyClassification
extends AbstractAlgorithm
This class provides a classification of automata and temporal formulae into the temporal hierarchy. Consider an automaton A. When the classification is performed top-down,
  • A is in the recurrence (response) class if there is a DBW B equivalent to A,
  • A is in the persistence class if its complement is in the recurrence class,
  • A is in the safety class if all runs of B stay only in accepting states after maximizing the acceptance set of B, and
  • A is in the guarantee class if its complement is in the safety class.
When the classification is performed bottom-up,
  • A is in the safety class if making all live states accepting does not change its language,
  • A is in the guarantee class if its complement is in the safety class,
  • A is in the recurrence class if A is in the safety class of there is a DBW B equivalent to A, and
  • A is in the persistence class if A is in the guarantee class or its complement is in the recurrence class.
Note that DCW can be applied with modification instead of DBW.
Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
